--- title: The `light_curve` package keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Code for generating fermi-LAT light curves. link to this document" description: "Code for generating fermi-LAT light curves. link to this document" nb_path: "nbs/index.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Background

This package has code that is being adapted to the nbdev environment from github package lat-timing to manage light curves of Fermi-LAT sources.

As pointed out there, it is based on a paper by Matthew Kerr,

And at the same time, I've ported some code from my jupydoc documention package to allow enhanced documentation combining Markdown and code. This is demonstrated below.

Installation

After cloning, in its folder run the command pip install -e .

Instructions on set up / use

instructions

Demonstrate some actual light curves

{% raw %} 
def plot_demo():
    """
    ### Light curve plots
    
    {print_out}
    
    <br>
    Test with {source1.name}:
    
    {fig1}
    
    This is to be compared with Kerr's Figure 1:
    
    {kerr_fig1}
    
    This flaring AGN, {source2.name} was used in the Kerr paper as well.
    
    {fig2}
    
 
    """
    from light_curves.config import Config, Files, PointSource
    from light_curves.lightcurve import get_lightcurve, flux_plot
    
    config = Config()
    files = Files()
    assert files.valid
    #files.clear_cache()
    
    kerr_fig1 = image('kerr_fig1.png')
    
    with capture_print(summary='printout from this analysis') as print_out:
        source1 = PointSource('Geminga')
        lc1 = get_lightcurve(config, files, source1)
        fig1 = flux_plot(config, lc1, fignum=1, title=source1.name)
        fig1.caption=f'{source1.name}'

        source2 = PointSource('3C 279')
        lc2 = get_lightcurve(config, files, source2)
        fig2 = flux_plot(config, lc2, fignum=2, yscale='log' )
        fig2.caption=f'{source2.name}'


from light_curves.config import Files
if Files().valid:
    nbdoc(plot_demo)

***fig_folders: ['', '../docs']
***fig_folders: ['', '../docs']
